segment.source: MD Conversion - Android custom policy settings in Microsoft Intune
segment.target: MD Conversion - Android custom policy settings in Microsoft Intune

segment.source: MD Conversion - Android custom policy settings in Microsoft Intune
segment.target: MD Conversion - Android custom policy settings in Microsoft Intune

segment.source: Use the Android custom configuration policy to deploy OMA-URI (Open Mobile Alliance Uniform Resource Identifier) settings that can be used to control features on Android devices.
segment.target: Use the Android custom configuration policy to deploy OMA-URI (Open Mobile Alliance Uniform Resource Identifier) settings that can be used to control features on Android devices.

segment.source: These are standard settings that many mobile device manufacturers use to control device features.
segment.target: These are standard settings that many mobile device manufacturers use to control device features.

segment.source: This capability is intended to allow you to deploy Android settings that are not configurable with policies.
segment.target: This capability is intended to allow you to deploy Android settings that are not configurable with policies.

segment.source: For information about the settings you can configure with these policies, see Manage settings and features on your devices with Microsoft Intune policies.
segment.target: For information about the settings you can configure with these policies, see Manage settings and features on your devices with Microsoft Intune policies.

segment.source: Currently, Android custom policies only support configuring Wi-Fi settings for Android devices that include a pre-shared key.
segment.target: Currently, Android custom policies only support configuring Wi-Fi settings for Android devices that include a pre-shared key.

segment.source: See Example: Configure a custom Wi-Fi profile with a pre-shared key to learn how to do this.
segment.target: See Example: Configure a custom Wi-Fi profile with a pre-shared key to learn how to do this.

segment.source: How to create an Android custom policy
segment.target: How to create an Android custom policy

segment.source: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Policy > Overview > Add Policy.
segment.target: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Policy > Overview > Add Policy.

segment.source: Configure a policy of the type Android > Custom Configuration.
segment.target: Configure a policy of the type Android > Custom Configuration.

segment.source: For help creating and deploying policies, see Use policies to manage computers and mobile devices with Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For help creating and deploying policies, see Use policies to manage computers and mobile devices with Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: You can only create and deploy a custom policy of this type.
segment.target: You can only create and deploy a custom policy of this type.

segment.source: Recommended settings are not available.
segment.target: Recommended settings are not available.

segment.source: Use the following table to help you configure the general policy settings:
segment.target: Use the following table to help you configure the general policy settings:

segment.source: Setting name
segment.target: Setting name

segment.source: More information
segment.target: More information

segment.source: Name
segment.target: Name

segment.source: Enter a unique name for the Android custom policy to help you identify it in the console.
segment.target: Enter a unique name for the Android custom policy to help you identify it in the console.

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Provide a description that gives an overview of the Android custom policy and other relevant information that helps you to locate it.
segment.target: Provide a description that gives an overview of the Android custom policy and other relevant information that helps you to locate it.

segment.source: In the OMA-URI Settings section, click Add to add a setting.
segment.target: In the OMA-URI Settings section, click Add to add a setting.

segment.source: You can also edit or delete an existing setting.
segment.target: You can also edit or delete an existing setting.

segment.source: In the Add or Edit OMA-URI Setting dialog box, specify the following information:
segment.target: In the Add or Edit OMA-URI Setting dialog box, specify the following information:

segment.source: Item
segment.target: Item

segment.source: More information
segment.target: More information

segment.source: Setting name
segment.target: Setting name

segment.source: Enter a unique name for the OMA-URI setting to help you identify it in the list of settings.
segment.target: Enter a unique name for the OMA-URI setting to help you identify it in the list of settings.

segment.source: Setting description
segment.target: Setting description

segment.source: Provide a description that gives an overview of the setting and other relevant information to help you locate it.
segment.target: Provide a description that gives an overview of the setting and other relevant information to help you locate it.

segment.source: Data type
segment.target: Data type

segment.source: Select the date type in which you will specify this OMA-URI setting.
segment.target: Select the date type in which you will specify this OMA-URI setting.

segment.source: Choose from String, String (XML), Date and time, Integer, Floating point, or Boolean.
segment.target: Choose from String, String (XML), Date and time, Integer, Floating point, or Boolean.

segment.source: OMA-URI (case sensitive)
segment.target: OMA-URI (case sensitive)

segment.source: Specify the OMA-URI you want to supply a setting for.
segment.target: Specify the OMA-URI you want to supply a setting for.

segment.source: Value
segment.target: Value

segment.source: Specify the value to associate with the OMA-URI you specified previously.
segment.target: Specify the value to associate with the OMA-URI you specified previously.

segment.source: Click OK to save the setting and return to the Create Policy page.
segment.target: Click OK to save the setting and return to the Create Policy page.

segment.source: Continue to add as many settings as you require.
segment.target: Continue to add as many settings as you require.

segment.source: When you are done, click Save Policy.
segment.target: When you are done, click Save Policy.

segment.source: The new policy displays in the Configuration Policies node of the Policy workspace.
segment.target: The new policy displays in the Configuration Policies node of the Policy workspace.

segment.source: Deploy an Android custom policy
segment.target: Deploy an Android custom policy

segment.source: Deploy the Android custom policy to one or more groups of users or devices in your organization.
segment.target: Deploy the Android custom policy to one or more groups of users or devices in your organization.

segment.source: For help deploying policies, see Use policies to manage computers and mobile devices with Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For help deploying policies, see Use policies to manage computers and mobile devices with Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: A status summary and alerts on the Overview page of the Policy workspace identify issues with the policy that require your attention.
segment.target: A status summary and alerts on the Overview page of the Policy workspace identify issues with the policy that require your attention.

segment.source: Additionally, a status summary appears in the Dashboard workspace.
segment.target: Additionally, a status summary appears in the Dashboard workspace.

segment.source: Example: Configure a custom Wi-Fi profile with a pre-shared key
segment.target: Example: Configure a custom Wi-Fi profile with a pre-shared key

segment.source: Although supports Wi-Fi profiles for Android devices, this feature does not currently support the inclusion of a pre-shared key in the configuration.
segment.target: Although supports Wi-Fi profiles for Android devices, this feature does not currently support the inclusion of a pre-shared key in the configuration.

segment.source: In this example, you’ll learn how to create an Android custom policy that creates a Wi-Fi profile with a pre-shared key on the Android device.
segment.target: In this example, you’ll learn how to create an Android custom policy that creates a Wi-Fi profile with a pre-shared key on the Android device.

segment.source: To create a Wi-Fi profile with a pre-shared key
segment.target: To create a Wi-Fi profile with a pre-shared key

segment.source: Ensure that your users are using the latest version of the Intune Company Portal app for Android.
segment.target: Ensure that your users are using the latest version of the Intune Company Portal app for Android.

segment.source: Create an Android custom policy and add the following settings:
segment.target: Create an Android custom policy and add the following settings:

segment.source: Setting name
segment.target: Setting name

segment.source: More information
segment.target: More information

segment.source: Setting name
segment.target: Setting name

segment.source: Specify a name of your choice for the setting.
segment.target: Specify a name of your choice for the setting.

segment.source: Setting description
segment.target: Setting description

segment.source: Specify a description for the setting.
segment.target: Specify a description for the setting.

segment.source: Data type
segment.target: Data type

segment.source: Select String (XML).
segment.target: Select String (XML).

segment.source: OMA-URI
segment.target: OMA-URI

segment.source: Enter the following: ./Vendor/MSFT/WiFi/Profile/<your Wi-Fi profile>/Settings
segment.target: Enter the following: ./Vendor/MSFT/WiFi/Profile/<your Wi-Fi profile>/Settings

segment.source: For Value, copy and paste the following XML code:
segment.target: For Value, copy and paste the following XML code:

segment.source: When you are done, save the policy and deploy it to the required Android devices.
segment.target: When you are done, save the policy and deploy it to the required Android devices.

segment.source: The new Wi-Fi profile will appear in the list of connections on the device.
segment.target: The new Wi-Fi profile will appear in the list of connections on the device.

segment.target: See Also

segment.target: Use policies to manage computers and mobile devices with Microsoft Intune
